audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an introduction to WWE wrestlers unlikely to win another world title, spoken by a male presenter in an informative tone. The presenter highlights the roles of particular wrestlers, giving a short background about each person. Following this, the presenter moves on to the next wrestler.

The audio begins with a male speaker describing how fans were "delighted" when WWE began to "push Bobby Lashley," adding that this resulted in some of his "finest work." The speaker highlights Lashley's multiple WWE title reigns, and how fans questioned why WWE waited to put Lashley in this prominent position. He continues, stating that since Vince McMahon took a step back, Lashley's booking has been all over the place and that it seems to imply "the almighty won't be winning world title gold again." He concludes this segment by stating that it's a shame because "Lashley still has a ton to offer to the company." The audio then transitions to a new segment beginning with "Number eight" and the name "Finn Balor."

The audio clip begins with a narrator discussing WWE's plans to make Finn Balor the top babyface on RAW and how he was supposed to win the Universal Title at the Summerslam event. The narrator explains that Balor suffered an injury and had to relinquish the title. He then continues, describing how Balor wasn't seriously considered for another world title upon his return. Though his fortunes changed when Triple H took over creative, the narrator states that Balor never won the big one. As the WWE roster continues to evolve, the narrator concludes that the chances of Balor winning another world title seem to decrease with every passing day. Lastly, the clip cuts off with the narrator exclaiming "Number seven, Jinder Mahal!".

The audio begins with someone discussing Jinder Mahal's career in a neutral tone, highlighting the surprise of his WWE championship win and his current role as an enhancement talent, while also acknowledging his respected status in the locker room. The speaker then transitions to discussing AJ Styles' career. Simultaneously, upbeat music, likely intended to provide background ambiance, plays softly in the background.

The clip begins with speech from a male speaker discussing AJ Styles' wrestling career, noting his initial hype and eventual plateau. The tone is analytical and descriptive. This transitions into the topic of Sheamus, a second wrestler. The audio suggests a reflective commentary on various WWE personalities and their careers.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker describing a common trend in pro wrestling and illustrating it with the example of Sheamus. He discusses the admiration of fans and the evolution of Sheamus's career. He references his body of work and speculation about another world title. The speaker then transitions to speculating about Sheamus possibly getting an Intercontinental Title reign. He then introduces Braun Strowman.

The clip opens with speech in a neutral tone from a male speaker summarizing a WWE event. The speaker then transitions to recounting the wrestling champion Bron Strowman, and elaborates on the reasons the fans were surprised by Strowmanâ€™s achievement. This voice is consistent throughout, discussing the wrestler's evolution as a character, his controversial release and subsequent return to the WWE, and his future prospects in the company. The speaker concludes by announcing Kofi Kingston as the next subject. Throughout the narration, there is background music, which can be characterized as an upbeat, energetic theme with possible keyboard and percussion instruments, creating a sense of excitement and intensity.

The audio clip starts with an assertive question, followed by a male speaker describing Kingston's career in WWE. The tone is analytical, focusing on significant events and their impact on his status. The speaker then highlights Kingston's continued popularity and potential legacy. The clip then briefly announces the next subject, Ray Mysterio.

The clip begins with a male speaker describing a situation in professional wrestling, where a wrestler can remain relevant without holding a world title, using Rey Mysterio as an example. His tone is informative and somewhat analytical, discussing Mysterio's popularity and box office draw, noting that "everything Mysterio does on screen is presented as important." He then says "It does not matter if Mysterio is world champion or if he's in the opening match of a pay-per-view event, Mysterio remains in a league of his own as a performer." The audio finishes with ambient noises in the background.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing John Cena's wrestling career, noting Cena's own comments and recent booking, implying an expected loss in future matches. He critiques WWE's handling of Cena, and its potential impact on fans' perception. The tone is analytical and critical. The speaker then expresses disappointment at the likelihood of Cena not winning another world title, but acknowledges that it won't diminish his legacy. The male speaker concludes, then mentions that he will see listeners next time with some more "wrestling content." Gentle, calm music plays during the segment, suggesting a reflective or contemplative mood. There are no significant background sounds to note.
